featured_reviews.review_id:
I am in an 8-story apartment building in the West End of Vancouver.  We have a single elevator, which has been out of service since about July 24.  (That is, we have had no elevator for over a month now.)  Our building manager has been unable to get any news from Otis.  Initially, we were told it would take about a week to fix it.  Then another week.  Then Otis said they would come on Monday, and simply didn't show up for a week.  They evidently don't work on Saturdays, Sundays, or holidays.

here are elderly people in the building who are missing their doctor's appointments, and who don't like being unable to go out for over a month.  I have phoned Otis Canada a few times, but have never been able to get any information.  My wife has cancelled 8 physiotherapy appointments. (so far!)  Now the long weekend is coming up (Labour Day), people would like to move out.

One person wanted to move out 2 weeks ago.  He can't, because there's no elevator.  I find it extremely odd that Otis will not work for double or triple overtime or whatever.  I have sent the main office (not the Vancouver office) 3 emails, which they cannot be bothered to acknowledge, it seems; there is not even an automated reply.  I phoned the Vancouver office just now - put on hold, and then transferred to a different number, which didn't answer.  I phoned the Vancouver office again, and there was no answer.  We have had no information at all from Otis for about 2 weeks now.

It's incredible, really - there are about 60 apartments in this building, and no one knows when the elevator will be repaired, or even if it will be repaired ever.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely Horrible company, they held our strata for ransom when they lost the contract to replace our elevators because they were 1M dollars higher priced and literally shut down our tower. sick people could not get ambulances to care for them and the firemen had to go up 38 stores to try and get to them. Clearly the almighty dollar is the only thing that drives this company. Their stuff is proprietary and they wont let anyone else service the elevator programming, give me a break. Welcome to the 21st century Otis ownership, Too Big, Too Fat, old guys in leadership not aware of how this could play for them online we have a voice!!! I hear Richmond elevator is eating them alive with customer service and fair pricing. Merry Christmas to the ownership. Start thinking about being good stewards to your customers because client experience is real now and will hurt your business for years to come. Governors Tower and Villas in Yale town

featured_reviews.review_id:
First time Customer alert  
Came in for a girls' night. Happy Hour ~

I had the mac and cheese that was amazing. -Perfect balance between rich cheese flavors and a satisfyingly gooey texture.  Pairing this delightful dish with a flight of craft beers is a match made in heaven.
-The server knew we had a long day and just wanted to talk, so they made sure we had our space to talk without interrupting.
The inside was a lot bigger than I thought and had an outside patio as well.

-Would come back and recommend though I do wish their happy hour served more options or a bit of later happy hour window.

Whatever you do, absolutely do not grab brunch here. The potatoes were served cold and the breakfast sandwich was inedible with what looked like an uncooked sausage patty. It's also ridiculously overpriced with sub par service and mediocre beer to boot.

Just head down to Modus a few blocks away for a simple and delicious brunch instead (and quite affordable!).

featured_reviews.review_id:
You can't go wrong with 33. Seriously though.

I recently had the pleasure of stopping in at 33 Acres Brewing after nearly a year. And I must say this place never disappoints. It was an amazing experience. The beer was incredibly delicious (as always) and the atmosphere (good music too) was super friendly and inviting.

The staff at 33 are always extremely helpful and knowledgeable, always going out of their way to make sure I enjoy my time and have a good time.

I would highly recommend stopping in for a pint or two if you're ever near the area as it's a really great establishment. The outdoor seating is also awesome and a great way to enjoy a sunny day. Cheers!

WARNING: They do NOT do growler fills. If you google "33 acres growler fills" the first result will tell you that they are doing growler fills, but it is not true (as of August 2023). featured_reviews.review_id:
We waited about 10 mins for an outdoor table around 4:15pm; it's seat yourself and then order at the bar. Unfortunately they stopped serving coffee at 4 so we missed out there, but the ginger beer I had was delicious and folks enjoyed their beers.

My biggest complaint was the popcorn I ordered for $5 that was clearly made several hours before and pulled off an open-air shelf by an employee when I ordered it. It was, as you'd expect, stale, and I'm a little puzzled admittedly as to why popcorn couldn't be made (or even kept?) fresh daily. I had a pretzel that had some interesting sides and was okay, though admittedly a little misshapen.

Okay stop for a pricey locally brewed drink, but I think the rest went over my head.

featured_reviews.review_id:
BEST PRICE IN TOWN with the same HIGH QUALITY products and service as other popular brands. Alvin, the owner, was very professional, knowledgeable, responsive, personable, and accommodating. He came on-site several times - something few companies do. They work VERY hard for you. One time, the painter ruined the HDMI cable, so Repel brought a new one - except it was defective, so they stayed a couple hours until Alvin's brother brought a replacement and retested everything before they left. It was so easy to just leave a new cable without doing anything, but these guys do everything with diligence.

We got their home monitoring install + service, security camera package, low voltage (TV/telephone/internet) install, home theatre package, central vacuum, water bug, you name it. Repel offers competitor top tier monitoring service package for a price cheaper than the competitor's basic price!

We've used their products for 3 months now, and the only issue I had was with the security cameras. The manufacturer is from China and partially state-owned so I'm a bit paranoid about installing their app on my phone. And we've had a couple of connectivity issues on the monitor. HOWEVER, it does the job so I can't complain.

If you are deciding between Repel and another company, always, always, always choose Repel. Save yourself some trouble, time, and money.

featured_reviews.review_id: My friend and I were cruising around and thought that it would be a good idea to check out this place. Not very happy with our decision though. The food was very bland, the patty of my burger way too thin and dry - almost burned, and basically there was just vegetables and an admittedly tasty brioche bun. Fries were good. I'm not expecting a gourmet burger at a brewery of course, but what I was served was unacceptably poor in quality, especially considering that it cost about 22-23$. Vibe of the place was ok, but definitely not a place I'd visit again if the philosophy behind it remains the same. I hope this feedback is useful in order to improve the quality of the food and services you provide.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Disappointing experience at this location. During our visit a few days ago in the afternoon, the restaurant wasn't busy at all, but we had to wait an unusually long time before our orders were taken. Additionally, when our server brought us water, we noticed that the glasses were dirty, which was quite off-putting.

While the food itself was decent, I would rate it around 4 stars, the service left much to be desired, and I would give it no more than 2 stars. To make matters worse, the staff added an 18% tip to our bill without informing us beforehand, despite the subpar service we received. This lack of transparency further added to the overall poor experience.

featured_reviews.review_id: Travelling solo and they happily accommodated me in the pub area. I could have chosen the restaurant area as well if I wanted. They have an extensive beer menu (as you would expect). The food menu is also extensive with fairly typical food options for this type of establishment (burgers, wings, pizza, etc.). I had the 1/2 ribs and they were phenomenonal. The meat was super tender and just fell off the bone. What made the accompanying fries so good was a tomato/garlic dipping sauce, which was sublime. They should bottle and sell that stuff! I'm not sure what the rest of the menu was like, but for the ribs alone it's worth trying! The service as slick and professional. I could easily have stayed for a couple more beers if I wasn't fighting jetlag.

featured_reviews.review_id: We were very fortunate to have been referred to Laddie and Innova Security Systems by a builder/friend even though our own builder had referred us elsewhere.  Through our research, the valued referral and after meeting with Laddie, we were convinced he would have our backs with regard to our home security and he and his staff did and continue to do so with exemplary representation. Laddie has tremendous technical knowledge, never stumped for a solution and vast up to date product information to always present to us best options. He provided and continues to provide us with step by step explanations of accessing systems/equipment, advised best options, price differentials, set up, etc. and virtually walks us through every aspect of our home alarm system, security cameras and fire protection. This constituted and still involves much time, effort, site and home visits and patience from Laddie and his staff to afford us this education and experience. Often we have had questions or concerns on a weekend and Laddie always responds and has surprisingly shown up at any time of day including evenings, Saturdays and Sundays to assist us. We believe this speaks volumes in addressing his character and the commitment of him and his company in providing an excellent service. We believe that reading reviews substantiates your evidence in the due diligence process, so we realize this and do not hesitate in recommending Laddie and Innova Security Systems. We are confident that it would be a challenge to find a better company for your home security needs.

I came across Laddi thru a close friend of mine who was building my house in Vancouver in 2016. After few detailed meetings, my wife and I, decided to hire INNOVA Security Systems for a full turn key project.
Laddi and his team were extremely detailed, explained me all of his work in a step by step process and time it will take. I am happy to say, everything was executed in timely fashion and everyone in my family was properly trained on home automation hardware that was installed.
I highly recommend Laddi / INNOVA Security to anyone who is looking for low voltage system installed by a very technically sound person.
I wish these guys success and for sure will use them in future.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
The part-time workers have noticed that this company is very inhumane. The employees have worked hard for the company for nearly three months and have not made any mistakes. There is no problem with their ability to work. They can find any reason to fire employees. They only take advantage of legal loopholes. During the three-month probation period, employees can be fired without reason. It's legal, it's very unfair to us workers, a regulation is not a good company! It's best not to go again and change to a more humane unit! No wonder their company keeps recruiting newcomers to try out and then dismiss them, a vicious circle! Very contempt disgusting!
There is one more disgusting thing. Before entering the company, you have to have a medical examination and buy iron-toed shoes. We need to spend at least 50 for the physical examination to check for tuberculosis and get the report signed, etc., and 80 for the iron-toed shoe market. Their family paid 40 physical examinations and 70 iron-toed shoes for reimbursement. However, the reimbursement will only be granted after the probationary period has passed. So the decision is entirely in their hands. You did not make a mistake, if they want to fire you, they will fire you. And they won't reimburse you, and they will confidently say that the contract says that they will be reimbursed after the probationary period. What a shameless unit!

I Am sure in my 67 years I have tried A LOT of different beers,,I Am not one who always drinks just one product, I like different beers depending on occasion. I like a guinness ( dark and strong taste ) at times.
My other go to's,, Sleeman's honey brown and Keystone red.
I must admit ,the packaging of Sneaky Weasel is what caught my eye,needless to say I was more than impressed with its smooth taste.
Now I tell my friends if they want a refreshing change try Sneaky Weasel.
Also great to support local.

featured_reviews.review_id: I am the co-founder of a new start-up wellness company. I came across FoodPak by total coincidence when a truck with their logo on it drove past me on the highway last summer. I had just been discussing the issues we were having around sourcing the sustainable packaging we had hoped to use for our new products, when I turned and saw the FoodPak advertising right there on the truck in the lane beside me. That was the beginning of what has been the most positive and professional experience we have had as new entrepreneurs on this journey. Nick was so informative and patient with our high maintenance requests, and went above and beyond with sourcing and creating the perfect packaging to fit the vision of our brand.  He listened, then communicated his plan, and then executed on that plan on budget and ahead of schedule.  We are already excited about what we can create with FoodPak in the future and are so grateful for the outstanding customer service and product we received.  Thank you!

featured_reviews.review_id: We came here on a Wednesday evening - it was busy but we didn't have to wait for a table. The atmosphere is very relaxed once you get used to all the barking dogs. Nice patio that's not on a loud, busy road. We had chicken strips and burgers and enjoyed them both. Out of the beers, I particularly liked the Session ale. We also scored some free deep-fried pickles when the kitchen closed as they made too many. Will definitely be back as it's a great, peaceful location on the Spirit Trail and easy walking distance to Mosquito Creek and Lower Lonsdale.

places.name: SMR Max Construction
places.address: SMR Max Construction, 1820 East Kent Ave S, Vancouver, BC V5P 2S7

featured_reviews.review_id:
I recently built our home and wanted it to be "smart". I'm a pretty techy person and I wanted the house to do everything I always wished it could do. I had a lot of things on my wish list, and a lot of questions.

I met with several vendors, and each one was different, but ADS was the only one where I was happy with the price, the service, and willingness to work with me to get everything exactly as I wanted it. Others would say "no one does that, it's not possible". ADS would say, "interesting, let me get back to you!" And they always got back to me, and they almost always had a solution. If it really was impossible, they helped me understand why.

Of all the things I did for my house, making my home smart had the most details to work out. ADS helped me work out every last detail exactly as I would want it, with lots of good advice and suggestions. And they are always very responsive to my questions, so I am reassured that if I need anything, they'll be there for me.

And I love my smart home!

Now, ADS' job is done, and I can confidently write this review, that they are awesome. Also, you'll soon learn that it is a father-son team, and I love that. Amarjit and Karn are super nice, and they will earn your trust very quickly. It was a big (and expensive) project and I wasn't just going to hand out my trust either, they really earned it with their honest and transparent dealings with me.

When you're dealing with a construction/reno project, trust is key to a stress free experience, and you're going to get that wit ADS. (And trust me I've had my share of horrible experiences!)

So now, I'm going to hire them to do my automatic blinds. They'll always have my repeat business.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I built my first home and had no idea of the capabilities of automation and smart features in a home. I got multiple quotes on the basic features I did not know about.  I received quotes from multiple companies  and I had no understanding of what work was going to be done or the benefits of it.

Karn at ADS was patient with me and explained the features and benefits of everything. They created a system that was customized for my family and our budget.

Upon completion of the work they have returned for service calls and upgraded my system from remote locations when needed.

They are always available to answer questions and help out whenever they can.

The best part of it all is Amarjit and Karn Love what they do and are always excited about new systems, and features.

They are a pleasure to deal with and I look forward to working on my next project with them.

featured_reviews.review_id: Recently, Tarum and Vancouver Solar completed our solar installation, which was a major component for our new home to gain a national, Net Zero certification.  Tarum made it easy for us and performed admirably.  We are delighted on a job well done!
featured_reviews.review_text: Recently, Tarum and Vancouver Solar completed our solar installation, which was a major component for our new home to gain a national, Net Zero certification.  Tarum made it easy for us and performed admirably.  We are delighted on a job well done!

featured_reviews.review_id: Tarum & his team were hired to install what was supposed to be a pretty straight forward 190+ solar panel installation.  The hicup was the delay of the new roof installation on the facility.  As a result Tarum had to work closely with the roofing contractor to make sure his installation met the warranty requirements.  I have to say that Vancouver Solar did an exceptional job of doing quality work despite the obstacles.  Tarum took care of all permits & dealing with BC Hydro to join its grid.  He made sure that the job was done right.  We are pleased with the finished product & would highly recommend Vancouver Solar.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Vancouver Solar was the best out of three quotes. I compared not only price per watt, but type of system and warranty. Our roof has many segments and some skylights, which added complexity, but the installation was done well and looks very clean. There are no visible wires on the roof although the system has 9 separate panel locations. Tarum the owner made the whole process easy including the permit application and the setup for net metering with hydro. He was happy to give me detailed explanations on the types of solar, we went with optimizers and an inverter, and answered many questions of mine. We're now 2 months in and the system is working really well. We've had no issues and the app is easy to use. I'm so happy to see our credits at BC Hydro building up this summer for when we need it in the winter.
In the end I cannot recommend Vancouver Solar enough. Great job guys!

We were building a new home and wanted to go all solar. We contacted some other companies, but Tarum was the most professional in explaining our options and had competitive pricing.
Tarum took care of all the ordering, permits and schedules, and worked with our builder for the installation.  He also contacted BC-Hydro to setup the net-metering account. It was a hassle-free and smooth process.

As we were the first solar in our area, Tarum had to spend a day tutoring to the electrical inspectors how the solar system worked.

We now have 44 solar panels installed on our roofs along with a battery backup system and it has been working great.

The guaranteed response time has come into play a few times over the years and I have always been taken care of quickly and efficiently.  Great personal service and follow up.  Professional staff.  I highly recommend Provident Security. I wouldn't choose any other company.

featured_reviews.review_id: Being a long tenured customer of this company means nothing - their accounting team's mistakes/deficiencies are blamed on customers and even though services are paid for in full - they refuse to fulfill their services. Horrible customer service - was not always like this...not sure what happened to this company. All our neighbours have moved onto other security providers and I can see why.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Provident Security is amazing.

Having had such a great experience with them in Vancouver (at our home and 2 business locations), it made sense to have them take care of our Whistler place.

I am amazed by how much convenience and piece of mind they have given me.

Provident has called us when our water sensors went off.  I know that we dodged a huge bullet (a friend didn't know about a slow leaking pipe in their place and it cost them over $100,000 and almost a year in renovations).

Provident has also let me into my own place (when I left my keys in Vancouver).  This saved my family and I over 4 hours of travelling time.

Provident - you rock

featured_reviews.review_id: Provident put the best possible spin on our recent break-in.  With the alarm ringing, the thief was in and out in 2 minutes and Provident arrived 1 minute later (i.e., in 3 minutes!) They definitely saved us from a robbery of much greater magnitude. Provident personnel could not have done a better job  - from providing accurate and reassuring details in the initial phone call to us, to greeting us with empathy when we arrived at the house, boarding up the broken window and even cleaning up mud and glass from the interior of the house.  They walked us through what had happened and gave us tips to prevent further break-ins. These two Provident employees really helped offset our distress at being broken into and definitely exemplified the high standards advertised at Provident.  We cannot recommend them more highly.

featured_reviews.review_id:
It's a cool spot. Really well laid out. Very nice outdoor patio. Food truck is inside and was pretty good.

The beers are all good.

BUT...everyone that works there just seems so miserable. So unfriendly. I'd honestly guess they hire for that personality.

I tipped 10% because the food was good.

But honestly what a bunch of jerks working in there. It's like they hate their customers.

If I was a hiring manager from another hospitality place, I'd never hire anyone from here.

Just so lame.  Good food though.  I might go back for food. But 0% for tips.

(I even embroidered a shirt with the TP logo). Aside from anywhere up to 36 different beers on tap (as far as I counted), they have a food truck INSIDE the taproom for a quick snack, and their patio is dog friendly. A note though that the neighborhood is questionable so go with a group.

This brewery should be rated higher,  in my opinion.  We had two flights after trying to pick from the 40 beers (all but cider brewed by them). The flights were great. The spot had plenty of seating and some skinny chicken wings, but don't let that discourage you. The sweet and spicy rub were bomb. Ended up, walking away with a mix pack and the yummy torque IPA. A new must try for our Vancouver trips

featured_reviews.review_id: Although parallel 49th isn't in the most glamorous location for food, the place itself is pretty wonderful if you need a place for a large group and good beer. You should know that you must first order your food and drink before sitting down. Food is best ordered to share, even though the portion sizes aren't the biggest, they aren't the smallest either, nor are they the best presented dishes. For a brewery, this place has a decent kitchen, mostly fried offerings.  Where they really excel, is the choice and quality of beer! They definitely have something for every beer lover in terms of flavors. I typically like to sit on their outdoor patio, but the inside of the building is also a great spot to hang out. Overall, if you have a large group of people and want to catch up, this place will seat you almost immediately and will feed everyone, within a reasonable budget.

featured_reviews.review_id: I engaged Foreseeson Technology to install a ChargePoint charger in my condo parking spot. It took them and Charge Point 7 months to bring the system online. I paid almost $5,000 and invested over 30 hours of my time to try and trouble shoot issues with both Foreseeson and Chargepoint. The list of errors created by this installer and Chargepoint included: 1. faulty hardware equipment on two occasions; 2. over two months of failed software trouble shooting; 3. one occasion of incorrect electrical settings by Chargepoint; 4. over 15 occurrences of Charepoint staff that could not help address charging issues. Although the final result is a working charger, the road to this point was a circus of errors and tail chasing. If you are looking to install, I would encourage you away from Foreseeson Technology and Chargepoint. I have had a very negative experience and would not recommend either company. Best wishes in your search.

featured_reviews.review_id: I used Nash Moving and Storage for a rather complex move, involving the sale of 2 homes with different closing dates, all items from one home being placed in storage for 3 months, and then moving out of the second home and moving all items into the new home over a 2 day period.  Nash Moving handled it all with ease, even making a last minute schedule change with no complaint!  The took great care of our belongings, securely packed, wrapped, padded and protected everything, and put it all back together in our new home.  They came ahead of time and quoted me on the move, were very competitive with their pricing, and they charged EXACTLY what they quoted.  I wouldn't hesitate to use Nash Moving & Storage for future moves, and gladly recommend them to anyone that asks.

featured_reviews.review_id: We have been using GCLC (Great Canadian Landscaping) for a year for our Strata's landscaping and we started using them for Snow removal this year (2019-2020). Our previous company over salted and killed a number of our garden plants as well as an expensive hedge. As well their attention to snow clearing was lacking at best. I was constantly out clearing our walkways and the city sidewalks that where our legal responsibility. GCLC uses IceMelt, a pet safe product, and a much more careful and thoughtful application that seems to not affect our plants as much, AND the "gold star", the snow clearing is down to the concrete. Our sidewalks are clearer than our neighbours! The areas around entrances, recycling and garbage areas are thoroughly cleared making me worry less for my older neighbours whom the slippery conditions are a hazard. Thank you GCLC! Wendral Court Strata North Vancouver

CodeTactic built my website two years ago. Throughout the entire process, all promises to fulfill and execute deadlines were met. Technical language and systems were explained in a clear manner for someone without their background to grasp.

CodeTactic ensured to understand my history, goals, and overall vision of what I needed my website to communicate. They took the time to ask all the questions necessary to ensure that we were always on the same page. Anytime I had questions and issues with anything they were quick to reply and provide solutions.

The end result is CodeTactic delivered on what they promised. I loved what they created. They have built me a website that I am proud to own. The website is an accurate reflection of the high quality of my business.

Their customer service continues to be quick, accurate, and helpful whenever I have a question with my site.

I would highly recommend CodeTactic to anyone who is searching for a company to take care of such an important part of their business goals!

Yohannes Petros
Founder/Owner - Hanes Hummus

featured_reviews.review_id:
Vancouver In The Box gave highly professional, exceptional work from start to finish. Limor and her team are amazing at what they do, and they provide courteous, caring service throughout. They come in with a plan, they hussle, and they get it done right! You won't go wrong in hiring them.

We began with an on-site consultation where Limor walked through the house, took notes, asked questions about priorities, and provided suggestions on how to proceed. We decided to utilize her team for packing as well as some unpacking services. I am so very glad we did.

It was critically important for us that we minimize the chaos of the move for Dad. He has memory issues that make any change to his environment frustrating and confusing for him. Limor proposed that we split packing across two days and leave the key pieces like Dad's bedroom and his tv room for the last moment. Also, they photographed Dad's space and when unpacking they essentially recreated it in our new place so that he immediately felt at home. It was brilliant!

I wish I had taken photos of the boxes they packed so you could see the attention to detail in their work. We did not lose a single piece to breakage, and we had around 200 boxes of goods being moved. Everything was labelled and colour coded. And their art inventory service is such a great idea, I highly recommend taking advantage of that too.

I'm not going to tell you it was cheap because frankly it wasn't. But let's get real here: we hired trained professionals to provide a skilled service that supported our move and made our lives so much easier. I can tell you with absolute conviction that it was money very well spent, and we received excellent value for our investment.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Best moving experience ever in my life. They came to my house and packed everything in two hours. Then they unpacked after movers finished their job. They helped me figuring out my new place storage cupboards in kitchen, washroom and closets.

This took away so much stress I had around the move. My new place was all unpacked and ready within two hours.

No cardboard boxes to recycle, no tape, wrapping paper. All was taken care of as they bring their own plastic containers which were picked up right away.

Stress free worth gold decision. So glad I worked with this company. I wouldn't do it any way in the future.

Highly recommend Limor and her team. They were amazing.

I usually don't write reviews but the level of service was outstanding so I feel compelled.
I was in a bind as a purchased a treadmill and .. yes they did say it was curbside drop off but I was in a panic when I realized how big and heavy it was when it arrived! I was going to get a buddy to install it but I decided to use First Lion when I saw how massive it was! I contacted them and they came to my rescue with very short notice the next day.
They brought the treadmill in and set it up for me quickly and efficiently. I have to say that they were so calm and professional I was SO IMPRESSSED and I felt so confident in their skills and knowledge.
i HIGHLY recommend First Lion as they were truly exceptional ! If you need an installation DO NOT HESITATE!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Bought a large wall unit for TV from Ikea, they put us in touch with Task Rabbit as their recommended installers. After several phone calls, emails, texts it became apparent that they new less than nothing about installing a wall unit or anything else for that matter. Although we were told they were professionals, the installer asked what tools he needed and if we would help him put it up. Not sure, but thought that was what we were paying him for to install and know what tools to bring. It became very obvious that we were gong to be in for a terrible experience so cancelled and started searching for an alternative.
I found First Lion online and thank you to all that have sent in their experiences and expressed their satisfaction because it was from those reviews that convinced me to go with First Lion. Spoke with Gabriel and was impressed with the very pertinent questions he asked, obviously knew what he was doing.
My experience: nothing short of absolute satisfaction. Extremely professional, knowledgeable, polite, hard working, perfect install. I expected to be pleased but was actually amazed. They are the only install company to use, bar none. More costly than Task Rabbit maybe, but worth every penny and more. They said they would arrive at 10am, they arrived at 9:50 and were working by 10. They finished at about 3 and although I asked them to take a break they politely declined and kept working. Gabriel and Brent were just two great hard working guys and deserve to get the kind of reviews that are listed here.
Do yourself a favour and skip the stress of a poor install and just get First Lion to do it right the first time and sit back and enjoy.
Can't say enough about them, really, awesome company.

featured_reviews.review_id: We hired First Lion to set up our downtown office which consisted of modular office desks, filing cabinets and partition walls. We will definitely be calling First Lion again in the future for our furniture installation and assembly.

featured_reviews.review_id: Gabriel came to help me with a delivery of IKEA goods to furnish one of my four bedroom suites. I wanted to try out his services first as his rates were very reasonable but I didn't know him personally. Let me just say that as a professional real estate agent I have many encounters with handyman/contractors but I am glad I called Gabriel as he was extremely professional, punctual, and knowledgeable with lots of care when it came to transporting my your goods and installation/building of my furniture. I will 100% be using Gabriel and First Lion Express again to get the other 3 suites furnished and have no hesitation in recommending him and his professional services.

featured_reviews.review_id: Gabriel is nothing short of heroic.  He returned my call within minutes, was extremely professional and pleasant, came the same day, and assembled a really heavy, bulky, complicated piece of Ikea furniture in two hours - all by himself when the instructions had said you needed two people.  The hourly rate is the same or lower than the others and without all the hidden fees.  He was so great that when I needed some handyman work done, I called Gabriel without hesitation.  Once again, he was tremendously kind and professional.  I think the second job I gave him was even more difficult than the first yet he did it graciously and with a big smile for a really, really good price.  Gabriel embodies what the tradespeople of a bygone era were like - incredibly service oriented, punctual, professional, completely trustworthy, honest, hard-working, and very highly skilled. As an aside, as a single woman, I am very careful about who I let into my home.  I had no hesitation about Gabriel and in fact when I had to step out for a few minutes he was even thoughtful enough to say "I'll keep your house safe while you're gone" .   Hire Gabriel.  He will give you the very best, highest-quality, most professional service for the best price.  He is the real deal.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had the most horrifying experience with this company today at the ESI spa show here in Vancouver. It was quite busy at the show with many woman in front of me at their booth looking at their lovely things they had to showcase and sell. It included their stuffed animals (warm buddies) , cozy robes and other warming bottles. Everyone was touching and feeling and when it was my turn I asked the woman how much the teddy bears were. She replied in a very rude tone "they're all a different price". Ok well how much is this one I asked, I would like to buy it for my daughter. $20 dollars! She said rudely and so I handed it to my daughter and went to get my wallet when she said "give me that one back or pay for it first if you want to see anything else, nobody wants to buy one that a child has touched". I was so shocked! So shocked. And so were the other women (whom I didn't know). They all put the items down that they were looking at it. And one woman said that's the rudest thing someone could've said. Especially a salesperson trying to sell their product! A child's product ! I was not only embarrassed and mortified about the situation, but my daughter was so upset when I told her I'm sorry we aren't going to buy this anymore. 15 minutes later when I was walking around a woman from a different booth approached me and said she was so sorry for what that woman said to me and my daughter. It was so extremely rude and unprofessional. They really should not have this woman representing their company. ( she was wearing a lime green long sleeve underneath her black vest with short hair)  Hopefully the owner reads this and addresses this issue so it never happens again to anyone else. I can't imagine anyone wanting to support a company like this. I know I can't.

EDIT:

Thank Karen for replying to me. I do accept your apology and I can understand that it was quite busy and probably would've added to your probably stressful day. I was just really wanting to buy a warm buddy for my daughter. Thank you so very much for your offer of sending her a warm buddy, she will be so happy about this.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
I am so sorry that you had a bad experience with my company. I was attempting to find a Warm Buddy for your daughter as you said you were not sure which one she would like. That is what I understood.
I was in the process of bringing choices for your daughter to see.
What was going on at the same time was a customer wanting a Warm Buddy that had not been handled. Normally I would have allowed your daughter to keep the labrador she had while I brought more options.
I wanted to explain what happened as I did realize that you were not happy.
This show can get very busy and I am sorry that you left without our resolving the situation.
I am the owner of the company who you referred to and this situation is not what my company is about.  It is always my intention to have happy customers and for everybody to have access to our products.
I would be very happy to send your daughter a Warm Buddy as that is what my intention was at the time.

Warm Buddy options can be seen on our website.
Kindly accept my apology as there seems to have been a misunderstanding which caused stress for you.
Please contact us at info@warmbuddy.com with a product choice and shipping address, I will be very happy to send you a Warm Buddy for your daughter.
Again, please accept my sincere apologies for the unfortunate experience.
Warmest regards,
Karen

Been using Wells on and off for about a year, just because they're the closest place to us and it was convenient when we needed something day of. The service never impressed us, so we werent consistent.

But today we went in and saw that they have signs encouraging people to defy the mask mandate and not requiring them the enter. Unmasked employees didnt even stay 6 ft away from us, even though we clearly took many steps back when they entered out personal bubble. We felt extremely dissapointed and disrespected. We will not be returning and have already contacted Burnaby bylaw. We will make the slightly longer drive to Pinnacle Distributors from now on, since they're service has always been amazing!

featured_reviews.review_id:
In marketing one of our client's new upcoming real estate development projects, we were looking for visual and rendering solutions that were not only unique but one that has not been used in the industry. In essence, we wanted to "wow" our developer client and also provide a wonderful representation of the project for prospective buyers and realtors to appreciate the realism of actually being inside of one of the townhouse units, through our project website, brochures and at our Presentation Centres.

Our results with Stambol have been amazing. Their 3D, 360, AR, and VR work for us has exceeded all expectations. Never before have we been able to offer such high-quality true to life images and renderings for a pre-construction offering.

Our client, prospective buyers and realtors have all been "wowed" and we are very happy with the work Stambol has done. The team at Stambol has been awesome to work with and dedicated to ensure client satisfaction. Stambol is a great partner for us and we look forward to collaborating with them with our future development projects.  We would greatly recommend Stambol Studios for anyone looking to do 3D, 360, AR and VR  in their respective industry.

Nevin Low, Executive Vice President
Nu Stream Marketing Inc.

featured_reviews.review_id: Our multi-family housing office has worked with Steelhead for 4 years now on a referral from another firm. We have exclusively used Toshiba products which work particularly well with our windows/Mac blended environment. I had nothing but issues with my enterprise level HP MFP because it would not get along with MacOs. The Steelhead team offers fast and thorough tech support. Many things are diagnosed and dealt with by phone and failing that someone is always available for s site visit. The sales team is thoughtful and interested in delivering the best and most cost effective solution. We don't need to think about our printing, copying or scanning needs because Steelhead always has us covered.

featured_reviews.review_id: I just saw the review on after sales support.  Let me tell you that if you want bad support, try companies like An.. or Col.... where you can't even get someone to answer the phone.  We switched to Steelhead about a year ago.  Average wait time to get someone to answer the phone - none.  (I'm not even going to tell you what the other places were like - and another nameless equipment place asked me to do something illegal - seriously).  Steelhead is either able to remote in or walk us through a problem in about 10-15 minutes or they have someone onsite in about 4 hours, which is critical in tax time.  One time with one of the competitors we had to buy a small printer from Staples because they were going to be days to fix a problem.  Days.  In tax season.  Really!  My office manager has just told me we're never switching because she can at least talk with a person at Steelhead.  They have been patient with us and we so appreciate that we aren't a big customer, but they don't treat us like a small one.

featured_reviews.review_id:
If your looking to revamp your portfolios I suggest looking into KLOportfolios. I am VERY picky when it comes to the print quality. I wanted something sturdy & not flimsy! I am so impressed. I received my portfolio today & couldn't be happier.

Mine is Acrylic Matte in Black with engraving & color fill. But they have different material options, like aluminum or veneer if you don't like acrylic, they have tons of different engraving  options with or without color.

The customer service is amazing! You send them your file and they work with you to get it perfect. Also the website is very user friendly. The best part: every portfolio includes overnight shipping, once it's done in production.

Below is the "cover" I haven't put my prints in yet. No filters

#supportsmallbusinesses

featured_reviews.review_id: What can I say about Klo, their work is phenomenal. I had to get a portfolio to graduate this May with a Advertising & Graphic Design Degree, and wanted to make a bold statement. My professor recommended Klo, as well as one of my friends. The process was super easy to set the file up for whatever finish you were getting (die-cut, engrave, etc.). Klo kept in touch, and usually answered back to keep you notified about the process. All I can say is, I can't wait to show it off at interviews, and even portfolio reviews. Worth every penny!

featured_reviews.review_id: My portfolio came with a huge scratch/scuff on it. I sent the picture to them and all they could tell me is that's how the leather comes and that it's part of the leather. I can clearly tell it is not part of the leather that something scratched it up. Not one of the images on their site show ANY imperfections. I paid a lot of money for this and upon receiving it, it should be flawless which it clearly is not.
featured_reviews.review_text: My portfolio came with a huge scratch/scuff on it. I sent the picture to them and all they could tell me is that's how the leather comes and that it's part of the leather. I can clearly tell it is not part of the leather that something scratched it up. Not one of the images on their site show ANY imperfections. I paid a lot of money for this and upon receiving it, it should be flawless which it clearly is not.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Karli,

This is a vegetable tan leather material so it's untreated and because we cut them from large hides, there are natural blemishes and imperfections.  This is 100% part of the leather.  The upside of vegetable tan leather is that it patinas over time and ages beautifully, darkening and evening out completely.  We note on our website that all of our leather will have natural blemishes as this is the very nature of leather.

We understand that mistakes happen although this is not one of them.  Please allow for the vegetable tan leather to take its course and patina, which will add beauty and character to your portfolio book and case.

featured_reviews.review_id: I have used Klo Portfolios twice. This is a small business that exemplifies what it means to care about your product and your people. I highly recommend this company both for the quality of their work and their above and beyond care for their customers.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Klo Portfolios is honestly the best place in my opinion to purchase your portfolio book, hands down! And this comes from someone who was very nervous and anxious about ordering. But from the very beginning to the end result I wouldn't have changed a thing and will probably revisit them in the future! The team at Klo is so supportive. I probably called quite a few times asking multiple questions about the process, how it works, which book would be best, etc. and they never hesitated to answer my questions. They always made me feel so confident and secure about my book with constant emails about the process and if there were to be any changes made, which I really appreciated a lot. And it so happened my book was engraved instead of a die-cut which worked out so much better! And they made sure to run everything by me first and send my proofs. They were always very professional and friendly. Willing to help accommodate any of my needs.

Words cannot describe how AMAZING my book came out. So much better then what I imagined!! So sleek and professional! Packaged perfectly and so cute and personalized with my name all over the wrapping which definitely made me feel special. When I bought it to class, so many students feel in love with it and we're blown away! They even decided to go with Klo for their books after seeing mine. Every job interview I have been on has said amazing things about my portfolio. It really leaves an impression. At my portfolio show, I'm not kidding jaws dropped.

I cannot express how awesome Klo is. From the every aspect they are with you and for you. I love them so very much!!! So please i recommend them so highly to you! And if this helps, I just got a graphic design job and let's just say my book stuck their attention ;)

Thank you Klo for your exceptional work!

featured_reviews.review_id:
As a young graphic designer, I'm doing a lot of things for the first time. Designing and ordering my portfolio definitely topped the list of firsts. Luckily, I chose Klo Portfolios to produce my portfolio.

The process to order and personalize was very user friendly and it was apparent that they didn't overlook a single detail. I felt confident when I submitted my portfolio design. Shortly after, I received a phone call reviewing my submission. It was apparent that they were in the best interest of the final product being flawless by suggesting and explaining size adjustments to improve my design. Timing was as promised and quality surpassed my expectations. I received an innumerable amount of positive feedback from family, friends, colleagues and professionals at the AIGA Portfolio Review in Raleigh, NC.

Klo Portfolios truly made the experience a great one and I couldn't be happier with my portfolio!

I'm not vegan/veg, etc. But I'm open to trying new things. I decided to give the chives and garlic cream cheese a try, and I don't regret it.

I tried it with plain nachos. The taste reminded me more of hummus - which I'm not mad about. It was really hard to stop eating it hehe.

Then, I tried it on a warm croissant - which reminded me of a cream cheese taste - just a little bit more acidic than a regular cream cheese. Which is also not a bad thing in my opinion.

All in all, I love it!

featured_reviews.review_id:
You don't have to be vegan to fall in love with Spread 'Em!
I first discovered them at the Vancouver Famers Market and was instantly impressed by the taste, texture and quality of their dips and spreads. The cultured cashew base is tangy and smooth, and all their flavour combinations are well balanced. I particularly like the jalapeno and truffle varieties. Their cilantro dip is awesome too. Spread 'Em's chef is always coming up with new offerings like olive oil and herb marinated vegan soft cheeses and a Philly-style "cream cheeze" that quickly became my new favourite (it is divine on sourdough toast with sliced tomato and cucumber). Highest recommendation.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We go through this stuff regularly, the dips are a staple for our kids (with veggies, on toast, on crackers, with dinner as a dip or sauce, etc) and the new cheese has become a solid dinner tool as well (makes amazing sauces, and is so versatile!).

My only complaint is that the new original cream cheese flavour is sooooo hard to find still! We found it once and smashed through it in 24 hours, it's so damn good, and haven't found it again since! So this is more of a complaint to all the stores out there not getting their s*** together to stock this stuff, because they need to get on that!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Shockingly UNRELIABLE service!

I scheduled a service appointment for the boiler at my parent's place in Richmond and was told that the technician will show up between 12pm and 4pm and will notify about half an hour before they arrive.  On the day of the appointment, they called 11 am to reschedule for the following week (same time slot) because a technician was sick.

For the second appointment, I waited for an hour and no one called or showed up.  When I called their office, the representative (Carlos) said that he would check and someone would call me back.  An hour and a half later, no one called.  When I called again, another representative (Stephanie) told me they could not make it that day.  After I told her to cancel my appointment, she offered $100 credit and reschedule me for two days later.  I rejected the offer saying that the credit is of no use to me if no body shows up for the service call as agreed.  She assured me that she would personally notify me about the new appointment.

On the day of the THIRD appointment, I traveled to my parent's place again and waited an hour.  No call arrived from Ashton!  When I called them, the representative (Carlos) told me he would check and call me back.  And no one did!  When I called the office again, another representative (Erin) told me that I got the time wrong and the appointment should have been the next day.  I told her to check with Stephanie, who offered me the credit and new appointment.  Erin kept saying that I got the time wrong.  At that point, I told her to cancel my appointment and I will take my business elsewhere.  She simply said OK.

Funny enough, about half an hour later, Erin (I think) called me back and apologized that the technician could not make it and offered to reschedule it for the next day.  I told her that altogether I wasted more than 10 hours waiting for service and they need to change their business practice.  And I told her I will take my business elsewhere for a second time.

If you need reliable service, find another shop!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had the opportunity to see Hedgehog Technologies from the inside as part of a six-week management project. I have seen the inner workings of a lot of consulting companies, and HHT is genuinely in a league of its own. It all comes down to excellence, inclusiveness, and fun.

First, excellence. This is a company that seeks out unique, challenging work that most other EE companies can't handle. This is a sharp, elite team that is brought in on complex projects where human lives are at risk and safety is paramount. This can be seen in their projects - roller coasters, deep-sea submarines, and more.

Second, inclusiveness. Diversity is good, but it's really inclusiveness that matters. I saw how deeply this runs in HHT's DNA. On my last day in the office and at the end of a successful project, I wanted to pick up a few bottles of champagne for the team. I mentioned this to the president, Mike, and he kindly mentioned, "don't forget to pick up some de-alcoholized bubbles, too." I had completely overlooked the fact that there were team members that do not drink. It was absolutely front-of-mind for Mike that everyone gets to be included.

And speaking of fun, there is a reason you see so many smiles on LinkedIn and Twitter posts. Be it games of Coup at lunch, team events, monthly food culture events, or Friday runs to the DL Chicken Shack, there is a welcoming nature to this team that puts a smile on your face plus they can solve the really challenging problems.

We only had a quick, informal meeting with Josh.  He started off with talking about what the company can offer and past projects, which seems really impressive.  However, when I described my project to him, it didn't seem like he was listening and at some point, actually pulled out his phone. Anyways, we took our project elsewhere, somewhere which seems to place more value into it, regardless of the size of our project.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi John, I'm really sorry we weren't able to help you. I searched through my email and I don't see any correspondence between us. Could you remind me what your company is and what you came to us looking for? I would be the first to admit that we do suggest to some people who talk to us that we are not a perfect fit when it either makes more sense to hire someone internally or go with an individual rather than an integrated engineering team, but I don't recall ever turning someone away without a good explanation of why it might more sense to take a different strategy. Many other firms may be more likely to take on the work even if it isn't the best move for the client. Are you sure it was our company that you talked to? Again, I'm sorry that we did not get a chance to work together and I hope that you have been successful with your venture.

Best regards,

Josh Usher
